dt: {bc}a mutual enmity or quarrel that is often prolonged or inveterate {dx_def}see {dxt|inveterate||2}{/dx_def}

dt.t: Because of a family {wi}feud{/wi}, they did not see each other for a decade.

et: alteration of Middle English {it}feide{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}*faide{/it}, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}fēhida{/it} hostility, feud, Old English {it}fāh{/it} hostile {ma}{mat|foe|}{/ma}
shortdef: a mutual enmity or quarrel that is often prolonged or inveterate; especially : blood feud

et: Medieval Latin {it}feodum, feudum{/it}, alteration (probably influenced by Medieval Latin {it}alodum, allodium{/it} land not subject to rent or service) of {it}feo, feus{/it}, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}fihu{/it} cattle {ma}{mat|fee|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}a feud between different clans or families

shortdef: a feud between different clans or families
